title: How to Make an Origami Mountain

steps.headline: Fold the top right-hand corner of the paper down as shown in the picture.
Fold the rectangular part of the paper over so it is on top of the triangular part of the paper.
Turn the paper over and fold the highest point of the triangle down to the bottom corner of the triangle.
steps.description: This essentially halves the size of the triangle and creates a "pocket" which will be used in the next step.

steps.headline: Unfold the rectangle on the bottom.
Fold the stand.
steps.description: Fold up the right and left bottom corners of rectangle at an angle. Insert the corners into the pocket formed by the folded triangle. This will form a triangular support stand for the mountain.

steps.headline: Fold the support section backwards and adjust it so that it supports the paper mountain.
Decorate your paper mountain.
steps.description: To add realism you could use some natural materials.

text: Fold the top right-hand corner of the paper down as shown in the picture.  Fold the rectangular part of the paper over so it is on top of the triangular part of the paper.  Turn the paper over and fold the highest point of the triangle down to the bottom corner of the triangle. This essentially halves the size of the triangle and creates a "pocket" which will be used in the next step. Unfold the rectangle on the bottom.  Fold the stand. Fold up the right and left bottom corners of rectangle at an angle. Insert the corners into the pocket formed by the folded triangle. This will form a triangular support stand for the mountain. Fold the support section backwards and adjust it so that it supports the paper mountain.  Decorate your paper mountain. To add realism you could use some natural materials. Finished!
sentences: Fold the top right-hand corner of the paper down as shown in the picture.
Fold the rectangular part of the paper over so it is on top of the triangular part of the paper.
Turn the paper over and fold the highest point of the triangle down to the bottom corner of the triangle.
This essentially halves the size of the triangle and creates a "pocket" which will be used in the next step.
Unfold the rectangle on the bottom.
Fold up the right and left bottom corners of rectangle at an angle.
Insert the corners into the pocket formed by the folded triangle.
This will form a triangular support stand for the mountain.
Fold the support section backwards and adjust it so that it supports the paper mountain.
To add realism you could use some natural materials.
